greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least prime number m such that binomial(n+m, m) mod m = 1.
comment: Also the least prime number m such that m divides floor(n/m) or m > n.
a(n) = 2 if and only if n is in A042948. - _Robert Israel_, May 11 2017
Conjecture: a(n) is the smallest prime p such that Sum_{k=1..n} k^(p-1) == n (mod p). Thus a(n) >= A317358(n). - _Thomas Ordowski_, Jul 29 2018
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(2)=3, since binomial(2+3,3) mod 3 = 10 mod 3 = 1 and 3 is the minimal prime number with this property.
a(7)=11 because of binomial(7+11, 11) = 31824 = 2893*11 + 1, but binomial(7+k, k) mod k <> 1 for all primes < 11.
maple: while floor(n/m) mod m <> 0 do m:= nextprime(m) od:
results.author: _Hieronymus Fischer_, Oct 20 2007
